fallback_responses.wheat:
Wheat is best grown during the Rabi season (October-March) in India. Key points:

â€¢ **Sowing**: October-December
â€¢ **Temperature**: 15-25Â°C optimal
â€¢ **Rainfall**: 300-400mm required
â€¢ **Soil**: Well-drained loamy soil, pH 6.0-7.5
â€¢ **Harvest**: March-April

Wheat requires cool, dry weather during grain filling. Avoid excessive moisture during maturity to prevent fungal diseases.
fallback_responses.rice:
Rice is primarily grown during Kharif season (June-November). Details:

â€¢ **Sowing**: June-July
â€¢ **Temperature**: 20-35Â°C
â€¢ **Rainfall**: 1000-2000mm
â€¢ **Soil**: Clayey, waterlogged conditions
â€¢ **Harvest**: October-November

Rice requires high humidity and standing water. Transplanting is done 20-25 days after sowing.
fallback_responses.fertilizer:
General fertilizer recommendations:

â€¢ **NPK ratio**: Varies by crop and soil test
â€¢ **Timing**: Split application for better efficiency
â€¢ **Organic**: Compost, FYM improve soil health
â€¢ **Micronutrients**: Zinc, iron often deficient

Always conduct soil testing before fertilizer application for best results.
fallback_responses.pest:
Integrated Pest Management (IPM) approach:

â€¢ **Prevention**: Crop rotation, resistant varieties
â€¢ **Monitoring**: Regular field inspection
â€¢ **Biological**: Beneficial insects, biopesticides
â€¢ **Chemical**: Last resort, follow label instructions
â€¢ **Cultural**: Proper spacing, sanitation

Early detection and prevention are key to effective pest management.
fallback_responses.general:
I'd be happy to help with your agricultural question! Here are some general principles:

â€¢ **Soil health**: Regular testing and organic matter addition
â€¢ **Water management**: Efficient irrigation and drainage
â€¢ **Crop selection**: Choose varieties suited to your climate
â€¢ **Timing**: Follow local agricultural calendars
â€¢ **Integrated approach**: Combine traditional and modern practices

For specific guidance, please consult your local agricultural extension officer or provide more details about your farming context.

disease_detection.title: Plant Disease Detection
disease_detection.description: Upload a clear image of the affected plant for analysis
disease_detection.upload_label: Upload Plant Image for Disease Detection

tips.lighting: Good lighting: Take photos in natural daylight, avoid flash
tips.focus: Clear focus: Ensure the affected area is sharp and in focus
tips.closeup: Close-up shots: Fill the frame with the diseased leaf or plant part
tips.context: Include context: Show both affected and healthy parts for comparison
tips.shadows: Avoid shadows: No shadows, glare, or reflections on the plant
tips.angles: Multiple angles: Take photos from different angles if symptoms vary

disease_detection.no_image_desc: Please upload an image to analyze
disease_detection.no_results_desc: Upload an image and click "Analyze" to detect plant diseases
disease_detection.treatment_note: Apply treatments promptly for best results. Always follow product instructions and consider organic options when possible.
disease_detection.fallback_treatment: Consult with agricultural experts for specific treatment recommendations
disease_detection.fallback_description: detected. Please consult with agricultural experts for specific treatment recommendations.

fertilizer_recommendation.title: Crop & Soil Information
fertilizer_recommendation.description: Enter details about your crop and soil conditions
fertilizer_recommendation.additional_notes_placeholder: Any other information about your field...
fertilizer_recommendation.missing_info_desc: Please fill in all required fields
fertilizer_recommendation.based_on: Based on {{cropType}} growing in {{soilType}} soil at {{growthStage}} stage
fertilizer_recommendation.soil_nutrient_desc: Analysis shows nutrient deficiencies that need to be addressed with a balanced fertilization plan.
fertilizer_recommendation.ph_acidic_advice: Consider applying agricultural lime to raise pH for better nutrient availability.
fertilizer_recommendation.ph_alkaline_advice: Consider applying sulfur or acidifying amendments to lower pH for better nutrient availability.
fertilizer_recommendation.ph_optimal_advice: Current pH is optimal for most crops and allows for good nutrient availability.
fertilizer_recommendation.no_recommendations_desc: Fill out the crop and soil information form to receive personalized fertilizer recommendations based on your specific conditions.
